lines.value: RODERIGO

lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: That thou, Iago, who hast had my purse

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: 'Sblood, but you will not hear me:

lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Despise me, if I do not. Three great ones of the city,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: In personal suit to make me his lieutenant,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Off-capp'd to him: and, by the faith of man,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I know my price, I am worth no worse a place:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: But he; as loving his own pride and purposes,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Evades them, with a bombast circumstance
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Horribly stuff'd with epithets of war;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And, in conclusion,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Nonsuits my mediators; for, 'Certes,' says he,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: 'I have already chose my officer.'
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And what was he?
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Forsooth, a great arithmetician,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: One Michael Cassio, a Florentine,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: A fellow almost damn'd in a fair wife;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: That never set a squadron in the field,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Nor the division of a battle knows
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: More than a spinster; unless the bookish theoric,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Wherein the toged consuls can propose
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: As masterly as he: mere prattle, without practise,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Is all his soldiership. But he, sir, had the election:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And I, of whom his eyes had seen the proof
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: At Rhodes, at Cyprus and on other grounds
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Christian and heathen, must be be-lee'd and calm'd
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: By debitor and creditor: this counter-caster,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: He, in good time, must his lieutenant be,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And I--God bless the mark!--his Moorship's ancient.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: By heaven, I rather would have been his hangman.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Why, there's no remedy; 'tis the curse of service,

lines.value: And not by old gradation, where each second
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Stood heir to the first. Now, sir, be judge yourself,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: O, sir, content you;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I follow him to serve my turn upon him:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: We cannot all be masters, nor all masters
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Cannot be truly follow'd. You shall mark
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Many a duteous and knee-crooking knave,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: That, doting on his own obsequious bondage,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Wears out his time, much like his master's ass,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: For nought but provender, and when he's old, cashier'd:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Whip me such honest knaves. Others there are
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Who, trimm'd in forms and visages of duty,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Keep yet their hearts attending on themselves,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And, throwing but shows of service on their lords,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Do well thrive by them and when they have lined
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: their coats
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Do themselves homage: these fellows have some soul;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And such a one do I profess myself. For, sir,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: It is as sure as you are Roderigo,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Were I the Moor, I would not be Iago:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: In following him, I follow but myself;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Heaven is my judge, not I for love and duty,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: But seeming so, for my peculiar end:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: For when my outward action doth demonstrate
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: The native act and figure of my heart
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: In compliment extern, 'tis not long after
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: But I will wear my heart upon my sleeve
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: For daws to peck at: I am not what I am.

lines.value: In an extravagant and wheeling stranger

lines.value: Of here and every where. Straight satisfy yourself:

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: More than pertains to feats of broil and battle,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: BRABANTIO

lines.value: A maiden never bold;
lines.speaker: BRABANTIO

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Her father loved me; oft invited me;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Still question'd me the story of my life,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: From year to year, the battles, sieges, fortunes,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That I have passed.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I ran it through, even from my boyish days,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: To the very moment that he bade me tell it;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Wherein I spake of most disastrous chances,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Of moving accidents by flood and field
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Of hair-breadth scapes i' the imminent deadly breach,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Of being taken by the insolent foe
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And sold to slavery, of my redemption thence
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And portance in my travels' history:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Wherein of antres vast and deserts idle,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Rough quarries, rocks and hills whose heads touch heaven
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: It was my hint to speak,--such was the process;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And of the Cannibals that each other eat,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: The Anthropophagi and men whose heads
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Do grow beneath their shoulders. This to hear
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Would Desdemona seriously incline:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: But still the house-affairs would draw her thence:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Which ever as she could with haste dispatch,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: She'ld come again, and with a greedy ear
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Devour up my discourse: which I observing,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Took once a pliant hour, and found good means
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: To draw from her a prayer of earnest heart
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That I would all my pilgrimage dilate,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Whereof by parcels she had something heard,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: But not intentively: I did consent,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And often did beguile her of her tears,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: When I did speak of some distressful stroke
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That my youth suffer'd. My story being done,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: She gave me for my pains a world of sighs:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: She swore, in faith, twas strange, 'twas passing strange,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: 'Twas pitiful, 'twas wondrous pitiful:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: She wish'd she had not heard it, yet she wish'd
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That heaven had made her such a man: she thank'd me,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And bade me, if I had a friend that loved her,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I should but teach him how to tell my story.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And that would woo her. Upon this hint I spake:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: She loved me for the dangers I had pass'd,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And I loved her that she did pity them.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: This only is the witchcraft I have used:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DUKE OF VENICE
lines.speaker: DUKE OF VENICE

lines.speaker: DUKE OF VENICE

lines.speaker: DUKE OF VENICE

lines.value: Take up this mangled matter at the best:
lines.speaker: DUKE OF VENICE

lines.speaker: BRABANTIO

lines.speaker: BRABANTIO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: My noble father,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I do perceive here a divided duty:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: To you I am bound for life and education;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: How to respect you; you are the lord of duty;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: BRABANTIO

lines.value: And passion, having my best judgment collied,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Assays to lead the way: if I once stir,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Or do but lift this arm, the best of you
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Shall sink in my rebuke. Give me to know
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: How this foul rout began, who set it on;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And he that is approved in this offence,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Though he had twinn'd with me, both at a birth,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Shall lose me. What! in a town of war,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Yet wild, the people's hearts brimful of fear,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: To manage private and domestic quarrel,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: In night, and on the court and guard of safety!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: 'Tis monstrous. Iago, who began't?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: MONTANO
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: If partially affined, or leagued in office,
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: Thou dost deliver more or less than truth,
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: Thou art no soldier.
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Touch me not so near:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I had rather have this tongue cut from my mouth
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Than it should do offence to Michael Cassio;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Yet, I persuade myself, to speak the truth
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Shall nothing wrong him. Thus it is, general.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Montano and myself being in speech,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: There comes a fellow crying out for help:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And Cassio following him with determined sword,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: To execute upon him. Sir, this gentleman
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Steps in to Cassio, and entreats his pause:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Myself the crying fellow did pursue,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Lest by his clamour--as it so fell out--
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: The town might fall in fright: he, swift of foot,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Outran my purpose; and I return'd the rather
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: For that I heard the clink and fall of swords,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And Cassio high in oath; which till to-night
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I ne'er might say before. When I came back--
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: For this was brief--I found them close together,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: At blow and thrust; even as again they were
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: When you yourself did part them.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: More of this matter cannot I report:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: But men are men; the best sometimes forget:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Though Cassio did some little wrong to him,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: As men in rage strike those that wish them best,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Yet surely Cassio, I believe, received
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: From him that fled some strange indignity,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Which patience could not pass.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I know, Iago,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Thy honesty and love doth mince this matter,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Making it light to Cassio. Cassio, I love thee
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: But never more be officer of mine.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Look, if my gentle love be not raised up!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I'll make thee an example.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: What's the matter?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: All's well now, sweeting; come away to bed.

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Lead him off.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And silence those whom this vile brawl distracted.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: offenceless dog to affright an imperious lion: sue
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: to him again, and he's yours.

lines.value: Come, you are too severe a moraler: as the time,

lines.value: the place, and the condition of this country

lines.value: stands, I could heartily wish this had not befallen;

lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: is now the general: may say so in this respect, for

lines.value: so free, so kind, so apt, so blessed a disposition,

lines.value: Probal to thinking and indeed the course

lines.value: To win the Moor again? For 'tis most easy

lines.value: The inclining Desdemona to subdue
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: In any honest suit: she's framed as fruitful

lines.value: As the free elements. And then for her

lines.value: To win the Moor--were't to renounce his baptism,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: All seals and symbols of redeemed sin,

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: That she may make, unmake, do what she list,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Even as her appetite shall play the god
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: With his weak function. How am I then a villain

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Directly to his good? Divinity of hell!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Plies Desdemona to repair his fortunes

lines.value: And by how much she strives to do him good,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And out of her own goodness make the net

lines.value: I know't; I thank you. You do love my lord:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: You have known him long; and be you well assured
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: He shall in strangeness stand no further off
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Than in a polite distance.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Ay, but, lady,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: That policy may either last so long,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Or feed upon such nice and waterish diet,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Or breed itself so out of circumstance,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: That, I being absent and my place supplied,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: My general will forget my love and service.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Do not doubt that; before Emilia here
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I give thee warrant of thy place: assure thee,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: If I do vow a friendship, I'll perform it
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: To the last article: my lord shall never rest;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I'll watch him tame and talk him out of patience;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: His bed shall seem a school, his board a shrift;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I'll intermingle every thing he does
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: With Cassio's suit: therefore be merry, Cassio;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: For thy solicitor shall rather die
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Than give thy cause away.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Madam, here comes my lord.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Madam, I'll take my leave.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Why, stay, and hear me speak.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Madam, not now: I am very ill at ease,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Unfit for mine own purposes.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Well, do your discretion.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Ha! I like not that.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: What dost thou say?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Nothing, my lord: or if--I know not what.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Was not that Cassio parted from my wife?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Cassio, my lord! No, sure, I cannot think it,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: That he would steal away so guilty-like,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Seeing you coming.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I do believe 'twas he.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: How now, my lord!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I have been talking with a suitor here,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: A man that languishes in your displeasure.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Who is't you mean?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Why, your lieutenant, Cassio. Good my lord,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: If I have any grace or power to move you,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: His present reconciliation take;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: For if he be not one that truly loves you,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: That errs in ignorance and not in cunning,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I have no judgment in an honest face:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I prithee, call him back.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Went he hence now?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Ay, sooth; so humbled
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: That he hath left part of his grief with me,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: To suffer with him. Good love, call him back.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Not now, sweet Desdemona; some other time.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: But shall't be shortly?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: The sooner, sweet, for you.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Shall't be to-night at supper?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: No, not to-night.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: To-morrow dinner, then?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I shall not dine at home;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I meet the captains at the citadel.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Why, then, to-morrow night; or Tuesday morn;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: On Tuesday noon, or night; on Wednesday morn:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I prithee, name the time, but let it not
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Exceed three days: in faith, he's penitent;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: And yet his trespass, in our common reason--
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Save that, they say, the wars must make examples
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Out of their best--is not almost a fault
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: To incur a private cheque. When shall he come?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Tell me, Othello: I wonder in my soul,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: What you would ask me, that I should deny,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Or stand so mammering on. What! Michael Cassio,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: That came a-wooing with you, and so many a time,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: When I have spoke of you dispraisingly,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Hath ta'en your part; to have so much to do
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: To bring him in! Trust me, I could do much,--
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Prithee, no more: let him come when he will;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I will deny thee nothing.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Why, this is not a boon;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: 'Tis as I should entreat you wear your gloves,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Or feed on nourishing dishes, or keep you warm,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Or sue to you to do a peculiar profit
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: To your own person: nay, when I have a suit
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Wherein I mean to touch your love indeed,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: It shall be full of poise and difficult weight
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: And fearful to be granted.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I will deny thee nothing:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Whereon, I do beseech thee, grant me this,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: To leave me but a little to myself.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Shall I deny you? no: farewell, my lord.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Farewell, my Desdemona: I'll come to thee straight.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Emilia, come. Be as your fancies teach you;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Whate'er you be, I am obedient.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Excellent wretch! Perdition catch my soul,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: But I do love thee! and when I love thee not,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Chaos is come again.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: My noble lord--
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: What dost thou say, Iago?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Did Michael Cassio, when you woo'd my lady,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Know of your love?
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: He did, from first to last: why dost thou ask?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: But for a satisfaction of my thought;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: No further harm.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Why of thy thought, Iago?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I did not think he had been acquainted with her.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: O, yes; and went between us very oft.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Indeed!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Indeed! ay, indeed: discern'st thou aught in that?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Is he not honest?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Honest, my lord!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Honest! ay, honest.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: My lord, for aught I know.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: What dost thou think?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Think, my lord!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Think, my lord!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: By heaven, he echoes me,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: As if there were some monster in his thought
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Too hideous to be shown. Thou dost mean something:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I heard thee say even now, thou likedst not that,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: When Cassio left my wife: what didst not like?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And when I told thee he was of my counsel
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: In my whole course of wooing, thou criedst 'Indeed!'
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And didst contract and purse thy brow together,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: As if thou then hadst shut up in thy brain
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Some horrible conceit: if thou dost love me,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Show me thy thought.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: My lord, you know I love you.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I think thou dost;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And, for I know thou'rt full of love and honesty,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And weigh'st thy words before thou givest them breath,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Therefore these stops of thine fright me the more:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: For such things in a false disloyal knave
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Are tricks of custom, but in a man that's just
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: They are close delations, working from the heart
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That passion cannot rule.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: For Michael Cassio,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I dare be sworn I think that he is honest.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I think so too.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Men should be what they seem;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Or those that be not, would they might seem none!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Certain, men should be what they seem.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Why, then, I think Cassio's an honest man.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Nay, yet there's more in this:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I prithee, speak to me as to thy thinkings,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: As thou dost ruminate, and give thy worst of thoughts
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: The worst of words.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Good my lord, pardon me:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Though I am bound to every act of duty,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I am not bound to that all slaves are free to.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Utter my thoughts? Why, say they are vile and false;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: As where's that palace whereinto foul things
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Sometimes intrude not? who has a breast so pure,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: But some uncleanly apprehensions
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Keep leets and law-days and in session sit
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: With meditations lawful?
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Thou dost conspire against thy friend, Iago,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: If thou but think'st him wrong'd and makest his ear
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: A stranger to thy thoughts.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I do beseech you--
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Though I perchance am vicious in my guess,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: As, I confess, it is my nature's plague
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: To spy into abuses, and oft my jealousy
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Shapes faults that are not--that your wisdom yet,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: From one that so imperfectly conceits,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Would take no notice, nor build yourself a trouble
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Out of his scattering and unsure observance.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: It were not for your quiet nor your good,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Nor for my manhood, honesty, or wisdom,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: To let you know my thoughts.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: What dost thou mean?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Good name in man and woman, dear my lord,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Is the immediate jewel of their souls:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Who steals my purse steals trash; 'tis something, nothing;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: 'Twas mine, 'tis his, and has been slave to thousands:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: But he that filches from me my good name
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Robs me of that which not enriches him
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And makes me poor indeed.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: By heaven, I'll know thy thoughts.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: You cannot, if my heart were in your hand;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Nor shall not, whilst 'tis in my custody.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Ha!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: O, beware, my lord, of jealousy;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: It is the green-eyed monster which doth mock
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: The meat it feeds on; that cuckold lives in bliss
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Who, certain of his fate, loves not his wronger;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: But, O, what damned minutes tells he o'er
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Who dotes, yet doubts, suspects, yet strongly loves!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: O misery!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Poor and content is rich and rich enough,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: But riches fineless is as poor as winter
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: To him that ever fears he shall be poor.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Good heaven, the souls of all my tribe defend
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: From jealousy!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Why, why is this?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Think'st thou I'ld make a lie of jealousy,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: To follow still the changes of the moon
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: With fresh suspicions? No; to be once in doubt
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Is once to be resolved: exchange me for a goat,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: When I shall turn the business of my soul
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: To such exsufflicate and blown surmises,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Matching thy inference. 'Tis not to make me jealous
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: To say my wife is fair, feeds well, loves company,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Is free of speech, sings, plays and dances well;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Where virtue is, these are more virtuous:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Nor from mine own weak merits will I draw
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: The smallest fear or doubt of her revolt;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: For she had eyes, and chose me. No, Iago;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I'll see before I doubt; when I doubt, prove;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And on the proof, there is no more but this,--
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Away at once with love or jealousy!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I am glad of it; for now I shall have reason
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: To show the love and duty that I bear you
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: With franker spirit: therefore, as I am bound,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Receive it from me. I speak not yet of proof.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Look to your wife; observe her well with Cassio;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Wear your eye thus, not jealous nor secure:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I would not have your free and noble nature,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Out of self-bounty, be abused; look to't:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I know our country disposition well;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: In Venice they do let heaven see the pranks
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: They dare not show their husbands; their best conscience
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Is not to leave't undone, but keep't unknown.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Dost thou say so?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: She did deceive her father, marrying you;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And when she seem'd to shake and fear your looks,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: She loved them most.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And so she did.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Why, go to then;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: She that, so young, could give out such a seeming,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: To seal her father's eyes up close as oak-
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: He thought 'twas witchcraft--but I am much to blame;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I humbly do beseech you of your pardon
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: For too much loving you.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I am bound to thee for ever.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I see this hath a little dash'd your spirits.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Not a jot, not a jot.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I' faith, I fear it has.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I hope you will consider what is spoke
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Comes from my love. But I do see you're moved:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I am to pray you not to strain my speech
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: To grosser issues nor to larger reach
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Than to suspicion.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I will not.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Should you do so, my lord,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: My speech should fall into such vile success
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: As my thoughts aim not at. Cassio's my worthy friend--
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: My lord, I see you're moved.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: No, not much moved:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I do not think but Desdemona's honest.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Long live she so! and long live you to think so!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO

lines.value: Till that a capable and wide revenge
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Swallow them up. Now, by yond marble heaven,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: In the due reverence of a sacred vow
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I here engage my words.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Do not rise yet.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Witness, you ever-burning lights above,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: You elements that clip us round about,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Witness that here Iago doth give up
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: The execution of his wit, hands, heart,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: To wrong'd Othello's service! Let him command,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And to obey shall be in me remorse,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: What bloody business ever.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I greet thy love,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Not with vain thanks, but with acceptance bounteous,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And will upon the instant put thee to't:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Within these three days let me hear thee say
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That Cassio's not alive.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: My friend is dead; 'tis done at your request:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: But let her live.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Damn her, lewd minx! O, damn her!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Come, go with me apart; I will withdraw,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: To furnish me with some swift means of death
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: For the fair devil. Now art thou my lieutenant.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I am your own for ever.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Do you know, sirrah, where Lieutenant Cassio lies?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: I dare not say he lies any where.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Why, man?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: He's a soldier, and for one to say a soldier lies,
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: is stabbing.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Go to: where lodges he?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: To tell you where he lodges, is to tell you where I lie.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Can any thing be made of this?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: I know not where he lodges, and for me to devise a
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: lodging and say he lies here or he lies there, were
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: to lie in mine own throat.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Can you inquire him out, and be edified by report?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: I will catechise the world for him; that is, make
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: questions, and by them answer.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Seek him, bid him come hither: tell him I have
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: moved my lord on his behalf, and hope all will be well.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Clown
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: To do this is within the compass of man's wit: and
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: therefore I will attempt the doing it.
lines.speaker: Clown

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Where should I lose that handkerchief, Emilia?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I know not, madam.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Believe me, I had rather have lost my purse
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Full of crusadoes: and, but my noble Moor
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Is true of mind and made of no such baseness
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: As jealous creatures are, it were enough
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: To put him to ill thinking.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Is he not jealous?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Who, he? I think the sun where he was born
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Drew all such humours from him.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Look, where he comes.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I will not leave him now till Cassio
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Be call'd to him.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: How is't with you, my lord
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Well, my good lady.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: O, hardness to dissemble!--
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: How do you, Desdemona?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Well, my good lord.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Give me your hand: this hand is moist, my lady.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: It yet hath felt no age nor known no sorrow.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: This argues fruitfulness and liberal heart:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Hot, hot, and moist: this hand of yours requires
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: A sequester from liberty, fasting and prayer,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Much castigation, exercise devout;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: For here's a young and sweating devil here,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That commonly rebels. 'Tis a good hand,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: A frank one.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: You may, indeed, say so;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: For 'twas that hand that gave away my heart.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: A liberal hand: the hearts of old gave hands;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: But our new heraldry is hands, not hearts.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I cannot speak of this. Come now, your promise.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: What promise, chuck?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I have sent to bid Cassio come speak with you.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I have a salt and sorry rheum offends me;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Lend me thy handkerchief.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Here, my lord.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That which I gave you.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I have it not about me.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Not?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: No, indeed, my lord.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That is a fault.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That handkerchief
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Did an Egyptian to my mother give;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: She was a charmer, and could almost read
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: The thoughts of people: she told her, while
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: she kept it,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: 'Twould make her amiable and subdue my father
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Entirely to her love, but if she lost it
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Or made gift of it, my father's eye
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Should hold her loathed and his spirits should hunt
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: After new fancies: she, dying, gave it me;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And bid me, when my fate would have me wive,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: To give it her. I did so: and take heed on't;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Make it a darling like your precious eye;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: To lose't or give't away were such perdition
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: As nothing else could match.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Is't possible?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: 'Tis true: there's magic in the web of it:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: A sibyl, that had number'd in the world
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: The sun to course two hundred compasses,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: In her prophetic fury sew'd the work;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: The worms were hallow'd that did breed the silk;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And it was dyed in mummy which the skilful
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Conserved of maidens' hearts.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Indeed! is't true?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Most veritable; therefore look to't well.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Then would to God that I had never seen't!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Ha! wherefore?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Why do you speak so startingly and rash?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Is't lost? is't gone? speak, is it out
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: o' the way?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Heaven bless us!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Say you?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: It is not lost; but what an if it were?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: How!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I say, it is not lost.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Fetch't, let me see't.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Why, so I can, sir, but I will not now.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: This is a trick to put me from my suit:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Pray you, let Cassio be received again.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Fetch me the handkerchief: my mind misgives.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Come, come;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: You'll never meet a more sufficient man.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: The handkerchief!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I pray, talk me of Cassio.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: The handkerchief!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: A man that all his time
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Hath founded his good fortunes on your love,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Shared dangers with you,--
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: The handkerchief!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: In sooth, you are to blame.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Away!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Is not this man jealous?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I ne'er saw this before.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Sure, there's some wonder in this handkerchief:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I am most unhappy in the loss of it.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: 'Tis not a year or two shows us a man:
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: They are all but stomachs, and we all but food;
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: To eat us hungerly, and when they are full,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: They belch us. Look you, Cassio and my husband!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: There is no other way; 'tis she must do't:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And, lo, the happiness! go, and importune her.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: How now, good Cassio! what's the news with you?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Madam, my former suit: I do beseech you
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: That by your virtuous means I may again
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Exist, and be a member of his love
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Whom I with all the office of my heart
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Entirely honour: I would not be delay'd.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: If my offence be of such mortal kind
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: That nor my service past, nor present sorrows,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Nor purposed merit in futurity,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Can ransom me into his love again,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: But to know so must be my benefit;
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: So shall I clothe me in a forced content,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: And shut myself up in some other course,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: To fortune's alms.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Alas, thrice-gentle Cassio!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: My advocation is not now in tune;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: My lord is not my lord; nor should I know him,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Were he in favour as in humour alter'd.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: So help me every spirit sanctified,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: As I have spoken for you all my best
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: And stood within the blank of his displeasure
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: For my free speech! you must awhile be patient:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: What I can do I will; and more I will
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Than for myself I dare: let that suffice you.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Is my lord angry?
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: He went hence but now,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: And certainly in strange unquietness.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Can he be angry? I have seen the cannon,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: When it hath blown his ranks into the air,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And, like the devil, from his very arm
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Puff'd his own brother:--and can he be angry?
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Something of moment then: I will go meet him:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: There's matter in't indeed, if he be angry.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I prithee, do so.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Something, sure, of state,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Either from Venice, or some unhatch'd practise
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Made demonstrable here in Cyprus to him,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Hath puddled his clear spirit: and in such cases
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Men's natures wrangle with inferior things,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Though great ones are their object. 'Tis even so;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: For let our finger ache, and it indues
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Our other healthful members even to that sense
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Of pain: nay, we must think men are not gods,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Nor of them look for such observances
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: As fit the bridal. Beshrew me much, Emilia,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I was, unhandsome warrior as I am,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Arraigning his unkindness with my soul;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: But now I find I had suborn'd the witness,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: And he's indicted falsely.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Pray heaven it be state-matters, as you think,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: And no conception nor no jealous toy
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Concerning you.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Alas the day! I never gave him cause.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: But jealous souls will not be answer'd so;
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: They are not ever jealous for the cause,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: But jealous for they are jealous: 'tis a monster
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Begot upon itself, born on itself.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Heaven keep that monster from Othello's mind!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Lady, amen.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I will go seek him. Cassio, walk hereabout:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: If I do find him fit, I'll move your suit
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: And seek to effect it to my uttermost.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: I humbly thank your ladyship.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: BIANCA
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: Save you, friend Cassio!
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: What make you from home?
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: How is it with you, my most fair Bianca?
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: I' faith, sweet love, I was coming to your house.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: BIANCA
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: And I was going to your lodging, Cassio.
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: What, keep a week away? seven days and nights?
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: Eight score eight hours? and lovers' absent hours,
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: More tedious than the dial eight score times?
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: O weary reckoning!
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Pardon me, Bianca:
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: I have this while with leaden thoughts been press'd:
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: But I shall, in a more continuate time,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Strike off this score of absence. Sweet Bianca,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Take me this work out.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: BIANCA
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: O Cassio, whence came this?
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: This is some token from a newer friend:
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: To the felt absence now I feel a cause:
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: Is't come to this? Well, well.
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Go to, woman!
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Throw your vile guesses in the devil's teeth,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: From whence you have them. You are jealous now
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: That this is from some mistress, some remembrance:
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: No, in good troth, Bianca.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: BIANCA
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: Why, whose is it?
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: I know not, sweet: I found it in my chamber.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: I like the work well: ere it be demanded--
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: As like enough it will--I'ld have it copied:
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Take it, and do't; and leave me for this time.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: BIANCA
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: Leave you! wherefore?
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: I do attend here on the general;
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: And think it no addition, nor my wish,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: To have him see me woman'd.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: BIANCA
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: Why, I pray you?
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Not that I love you not.
