lines.value: I do not know; I am sure I am none such.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Do not weep, do not weep. Alas the day!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Hath she forsook so many noble matches,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Her father and her country and her friends,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: To be call'd whore? would it not make one weep?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: It is my wretched fortune.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Beshrew him for't!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: How comes this trick upon him?
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Nay, heaven doth know.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I will be hang'd, if some eternal villain,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Some busy and insinuating rogue,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Some cogging, cozening slave, to get some office,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Have not devised this slander; I'll be hang'd else.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Fie, there is no such man; it is impossible.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: If any such there be, heaven pardon him!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: A halter pardon him! and hell gnaw his bones!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Why should he call her whore? who keeps her company?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: What place? what time? what form? what likelihood?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: The Moor's abused by some most villanous knave,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Some base notorious knave, some scurvy fellow.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: O heaven, that such companions thou'ldst unfold,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: And put in every honest hand a whip
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: To lash the rascals naked through the world
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Even from the east to the west!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Speak within door.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: O, fie upon them! Some such squire he was
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: That turn'd your wit the seamy side without,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: And made you to suspect me with the Moor.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: You are a fool; go to.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: O good Iago,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: What shall I do to win my lord again?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Good friend, go to him; for, by this light of heaven,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I know not how I lost him. Here I kneel:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: If e'er my will did trespass 'gainst his love,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Either in discourse of thought or actual deed,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Or that mine eyes, mine ears, or any sense,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Delighted them in any other form;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Or that I do not yet, and ever did.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: And ever will--though he do shake me off
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: To beggarly divorcement--love him dearly,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Comfort forswear me! Unkindness may do much;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: And his unkindness may defeat my life,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: But never taint my love. I cannot say 'whore:'
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: It does abhor me now I speak the word;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: To do the act that might the addition earn
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Not the world's mass of vanity could make me.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I pray you, be content; 'tis but his humour:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: The business of the state does him offence,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And he does chide with you.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: If 'twere no other--
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: 'Tis but so, I warrant.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Hark, how these instruments summon to supper!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: The messengers of Venice stay the meat;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Go in, and weep not; all things shall be well.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: How now, Roderigo!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: I do not find that thou dealest justly with me.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: What in the contrary?
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: Every day thou daffest me with some device, Iago;
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: and rather, as it seems to me now, keepest from me
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: all conveniency than suppliest me with the least
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: advantage of hope. I will indeed no longer endure
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: it, nor am I yet persuaded to put up in peace what
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: already I have foolishly suffered.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Will you hear me, Roderigo?
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: 'Faith, I have heard too much, for your words and
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: performances are no kin together.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: You charge me most unjustly.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: With nought but truth. I have wasted myself out of
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: my means. The jewels you have had from me to
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: deliver to Desdemona would half have corrupted a
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: votarist: you have told me she hath received them
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: and returned me expectations and comforts of sudden
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: respect and acquaintance, but I find none.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Well; go to; very well.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: Very well! go to! I cannot go to, man; nor 'tis
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: not very well: nay, I think it is scurvy, and begin
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: to find myself fobbed in it.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Very well.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: I tell you 'tis not very well. I will make myself
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: known to Desdemona: if she will return me my
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: jewels, I will give over my suit and repent my
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: unlawful solicitation; if not, assure yourself I
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: will seek satisfaction of you.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: You have said now.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: Ay, and said nothing but what I protest intendment of doing.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Why, now I see there's mettle in thee, and even from
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: this instant to build on thee a better opinion than
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: ever before. Give me thy hand, Roderigo: thou hast
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: taken against me a most just exception; but yet, I
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: protest, I have dealt most directly in thy affair.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: It hath not appeared.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I grant indeed it hath not appeared, and your
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: suspicion is not without wit and judgment. But,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Roderigo, if thou hast that in thee indeed, which I
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: have greater reason to believe now than ever, I mean
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: purpose, courage and valour, this night show it: if
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: thou the next night following enjoy not Desdemona,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: take me from this world with treachery and devise
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: engines for my life.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: Well, what is it? is it within reason and compass?
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Sir, there is especial commission come from Venice
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: to depute Cassio in Othello's place.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: Is that true? why, then Othello and Desdemona
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: return again to Venice.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: O, no; he goes into Mauritania and takes away with
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: him the fair Desdemona, unless his abode be
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: lingered here by some accident: wherein none can be
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: so determinate as the removing of Cassio.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: How do you mean, removing of him?
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Why, by making him uncapable of Othello's place;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: knocking out his brains.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: And that you would have me to do?
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Ay, if you dare do yourself a profit and a right.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: He sups to-night with a harlotry, and thither will I
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: go to him: he knows not yet of his horrorable
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: fortune. If you will watch his going thence, which
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I will fashion to fall out between twelve and one,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: you may take him at your pleasure: I will be near
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: to second your attempt, and he shall fall between
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: us. Come, stand not amazed at it, but go along with
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: me; I will show you such a necessity in his death
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: that you shall think yourself bound to put it on
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: him. It is now high suppertime, and the night grows
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: to waste: about it.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: I will hear further reason for this.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And you shall be satisfied.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: I do beseech you, sir, trouble yourself no further.
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: O, pardon me: 'twill do me good to walk.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Madam, good night; I humbly thank your ladyship.
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Your honour is most welcome.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Will you walk, sir?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: O,--Desdemona,--
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: My lord?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Get you to bed on the instant; I will be returned
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: forthwith: dismiss your attendant there: look it be done.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I will, my lord.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: How goes it now? he looks gentler than he did.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: He says he will return incontinent:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: He hath commanded me to go to bed,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: And bade me to dismiss you.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Dismiss me!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: It was his bidding: therefore, good Emilia,.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Give me my nightly wearing, and adieu:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: We must not now displease him.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I would you had never seen him!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: So would not I	my love doth so approve him,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: That even his stubbornness, his cheques, his frowns--
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Prithee, unpin me,--have grace and favour in them.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I have laid those sheets you bade me on the bed.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: All's one. Good faith, how foolish are our minds!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: If I do die before thee prithee, shroud me
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: In one of those same sheets.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Come, come you talk.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: My mother had a maid call'd Barbara:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: She was in love, and he she loved proved mad
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: And did forsake her: she had a song of 'willow;'
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: An old thing 'twas, but it express'd her fortune,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: And she died singing it: that song to-night
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Will not go from my mind; I have much to do,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: But to go hang my head all at one side,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: And sing it like poor Barbara. Prithee, dispatch.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Shall I go fetch your night-gown?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: No, unpin me here.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: This Lodovico is a proper man.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: A very handsome man.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: He speaks well.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I know a lady in Venice would have walked barefoot
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: to Palestine for a touch of his nether lip.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: [Singing]  The poor soul sat sighing by a sycamore tree,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Sing all a green willow:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Her hand on her bosom, her head on her knee,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Sing willow, willow, willow:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: The fresh streams ran by her, and murmur'd her moans;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Sing willow, willow, willow;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Her salt tears fell from her, and soften'd the stones;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Lay by these:--
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Sing willow, willow, willow;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Prithee, hie thee; he'll come anon:--
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Sing all a green willow must be my garland.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Let nobody blame him; his scorn I approve,-
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Nay, that's not next.--Hark! who is't that knocks?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: It's the wind.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: [Singing]  I call'd my love false love; but what
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: said he then?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Sing willow, willow, willow:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: If I court moe women, you'll couch with moe men!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: So, get thee gone; good night Ate eyes do itch;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Doth that bode weeping?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: 'Tis neither here nor there.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I have heard it said so. O, these men, these men!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Dost thou in conscience think,--tell me, Emilia,--
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: That there be women do abuse their husbands
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: In such gross kind?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: There be some such, no question.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Wouldst thou do such a deed for all the world?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Why, would not you?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: No, by this heavenly light!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Nor I neither by this heavenly light;
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I might do't as well i' the dark.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Wouldst thou do such a deed for all the world?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: The world's a huge thing: it is a great price.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: For a small vice.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: In troth, I think thou wouldst not.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: In troth, I think I should; and undo't when I had
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: done. Marry, I would not do such a thing for a
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: joint-ring, nor for measures of lawn, nor for
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: gowns, petticoats, nor caps, nor any petty
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: exhibition; but for the whole world,--why, who would
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: not make her husband a cuckold to make him a
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: monarch? I should venture purgatory for't.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Beshrew me, if I would do such a wrong
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: For the whole world.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Why the wrong is but a wrong i' the world: and
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: having the world for your labour, tis a wrong in your
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: own world, and you might quickly make it right.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I do not think there is any such woman.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Yes, a dozen; and as many to the vantage as would
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: store the world they played for.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: But I do think it is their husbands' faults
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: If wives do fall: say that they slack their duties,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: And pour our treasures into foreign laps,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Or else break out in peevish jealousies,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Throwing restraint upon us; or say they strike us,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Or scant our former having in despite;
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Why, we have galls, and though we have some grace,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Yet have we some revenge. Let husbands know
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Their wives have sense like them: they see and smell
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: And have their palates both for sweet and sour,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: As husbands have. What is it that they do
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: When they change us for others? Is it sport?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I think it is: and doth affection breed it?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I think it doth: is't frailty that thus errs?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: It is so too: and have not we affections,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Desires for sport, and frailty, as men have?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Then let them use us well: else let them know,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: The ills we do, their ills instruct us so.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Good night, good night: heaven me such uses send,
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Not to pick bad from bad, but by bad mend!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Here, stand behind this bulk; straight will he come:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Wear thy good rapier bare, and put it home:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Quick, quick; fear nothing; I'll be at thy elbow:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: It makes us, or it mars us; think on that,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And fix most firm thy resolution.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: Be near at hand; I may miscarry in't.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Here, at thy hand: be bold, and take thy stand.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: I have no great devotion to the deed;
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: And yet he hath given me satisfying reasons:
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: 'Tis but a man gone. Forth, my sword: he dies.
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I have rubb'd this young quat almost to the sense,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And he grows angry. Now, whether he kill Cassio,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Or Cassio him, or each do kill the other,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Every way makes my gain: live Roderigo,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: He calls me to a restitution large
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Of gold and jewels that I bobb'd from him,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: As gifts to Desdemona;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: It must not be: if Cassio do remain,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: He hath a daily beauty in his life
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: That makes me ugly; and, besides, the Moor
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: May unfold me to him; there stand I in much peril:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: No, he must die. But so: I hear him coming.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: I know his gait, 'tis he.--Villain, thou diest!
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: That thrust had been mine enemy indeed,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: But that my coat is better than thou know'st
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: I will make proof of thine.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: O, I am slain!
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: CASSIO

lines.value: The voice of Cassio: Iago keeps his word.

lines.value: RODERIGO
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: O, villain that I am!

lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: 'Tis he:--O brave Iago, honest and just,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That hast such noble sense of thy friend's wrong!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Thou teachest me. Minion, your dear lies dead,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And your unblest fate hies: strumpet, I come.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Forth of my heart those charms, thine eyes, are blotted;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Thy bed, lust-stain'd, shall with lust's blood be spotted.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: O, help!

lines.value: RODERIGO

lines.value: LODOVICO

lines.value: IAGO

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: RODERIGO

lines.value: O damn'd Iago! O inhuman dog!
lines.speaker: RODERIGO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Kill men i' the dark!--Where be these bloody thieves?--
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: How silent is this town!--Ho! murder! murder!--

lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: IAGO

lines.value: IAGO

lines.value: Marry, heaven forbid!

lines.value: What is the matter, ho? who is't that cried?

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Who is't that cried!

lines.value: BIANCA

lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: O notable strumpet! Cassio, may you suspect

lines.value: Who they should be that have thus many led you?
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: CASSIO

lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: GRATIANO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Lend me a garter. So. O, for a chair,

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: BIANCA

lines.value: Alas, he faints! O Cassio, Cassio, Cassio!
lines.speaker: BIANCA

lines.value: IAGO

lines.value: Gentlemen all, I do suspect this trash

lines.value: To be a party in this injury.

lines.value: Patience awhile, good Cassio. Come, come;
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Lend me a light. Know we this face or no?
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: IAGO

lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Signior Gratiano? I cry you gentle pardon;

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: IAGO

lines.value: GRATIANO

lines.value: Roderigo!
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: IAGO

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: Some good man bear him carefully from hence;
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: I'll fetch the general's surgeon.

lines.value: For you, mistress,
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: Save you your labour. He that lies slain

lines.value: here, Cassio,

lines.value: o' the air.

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Behold her well; I pray you, look upon her:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Though tongues were out of use.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA

lines.value: 'Las, what's the matter? what's the matter, husband?

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Cassio hath here been set on in the dark
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: By Roderigo and fellows that are scaped:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: He's almost slain, and Roderigo dead.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Alas, good gentleman! alas, good Cassio!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: This is the fruit of whoring. Prithee, Emilia,

lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: BIANCA

lines.value: He supp'd at my house; but I therefore shake not.

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA

lines.value: BIANCA

lines.value: EMILIA

lines.value: As I! foh! fie upon thee!

lines.value: IAGO

lines.value: Kind gentlemen, let's go see poor Cassio dress'd.

lines.value: Come, mistress, you must tell's another tale.

lines.value: Emilia run you to the citadel,
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: And tell my lord and lady what hath happ'd.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Will you go on? I pray.

OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: It is the cause, it is the cause, my soul,--
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Let me not name it to you, you chaste stars!--
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: It is the cause. Yet I'll not shed her blood;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Nor scar that whiter skin of hers than snow,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And smooth as monumental alabaster.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Yet she must die, else she'll betray more men.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Put out the light, and then put out the light:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: If I quench thee, thou flaming minister,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I can again thy former light restore,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Should I repent me: but once put out thy light,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Thou cunning'st pattern of excelling nature,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I know not where is that Promethean heat
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That can thy light relume. When I have pluck'd the rose,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I cannot give it vital growth again.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: It must needs wither: I'll smell it on the tree.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Ah balmy breath, that dost almost persuade
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Justice to break her sword! One more, one more.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Be thus when thou art dead, and I will kill thee,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And love thee after. One more, and this the last:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: So sweet was ne'er so fatal. I must weep,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: But they are cruel tears: this sorrow's heavenly;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: It strikes where it doth love. She wakes.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Will you come to bed, my lord?

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA

lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: If you bethink yourself of any crime

lines.value: Unreconciled as yet to heaven and grace,

lines.value: Solicit for it straight.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Alas, my lord, what do you mean by that?

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Well, do it, and be brief; I will walk by:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I would not kill thy unprepared spirit;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Talk you of killing?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Ay, I do.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Then heaven
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Have mercy on me!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Amen, with all my heart!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: If you say so, I hope you will not kill me.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Hum!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: And yet I fear you; for you are fatal then

lines.value: When your eyes roll so: why I should fear I know not,

lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Think on thy sins.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: They are loves I bear to you.

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Ay, and for that thou diest.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: That death's unnatural that kills for loving.

lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Some bloody passion shakes your very frame:
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: These are portents; but yet I hope, I hope,

lines.value: They do not point on me.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Peace, and be still!

lines.value: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I will so. What's the matter?

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Sweet soul, take heed,

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Ay, but not yet to die.

lines.value: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Then Lord have mercy on me!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I say, amen.

lines.value: DESDEMONA

lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: But with such general warranty of heaven

lines.value: OTHELLO

lines.value: By heaven, I saw my handkerchief in's hand.

lines.value: And makest me call what I intend to do

lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: He found it then;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: I never gave it him: send for him hither;
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Let him confess a truth.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: He hath confess'd.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: What, my lord?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That he hath used thee.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: How? unlawfully?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Ay.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: He will not say so.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: No, his mouth is stopp'd;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Honest Iago hath ta'en order for't.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: O! my fear interprets: what, is he dead?
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Had all his hairs been lives, my great revenge
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Had stomach for them all.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Alas! he is betray'd and I undone.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Out, strumpet! weep'st thou for him to my face?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: O, banish me, my lord, but kill me not!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Down, strumpet!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Kill me to-morrow: let me live to-night!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Nay, if you strive--
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: But half an hour!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Being done, there is no pause.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: But while I say one prayer!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: It is too late.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: [Within]  My lord , my lord! what, ho! my lord, my lord!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: What noise is this? Not dead? not yet quite dead?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I that am cruel am yet merciful;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I would not have thee linger in thy pain: So, so.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: [Within]  What, ho! my lord, my lord!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Who's there?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: [Within]  O, good my lord, I would speak a word with you!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Yes: 'tis Emilia. By and by. She's dead.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: 'Tis like she comes to speak of Cassio's death.--
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: The noise was here. Ha! no more moving?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Still as the grave. Shall she come in? were't good?--
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I think she stirs again:--no. What's best to do?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: If she come in, she'll sure speak to my wife:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: My wife! my wife! what wife? I have no wife.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: O insupportable! O heavy hour!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Methinks it should be now a huge eclipse
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Of sun and moon, and that the affrighted globe
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Should yawn at alteration.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: [Within]  I do beseech you
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: That I may speak with you, O, good my lord!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I had forgot thee: O, come in, Emilia;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Soft; by and by. Let me the curtains draw.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Where art thou?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: What's the matter with thee now?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: O, my good lord, yonder's foul murders done!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: What, now?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: But now, my lord.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: It is the very error of the moon;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: She comes more nearer earth than she was wont,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And makes men mad.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Cassio, my lord, hath kill'd a young Venetian
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Call'd Roderigo.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Roderigo kill'd!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And Cassio kill'd!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: No, Cassio is not kill'd.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Not Cassio kill'd! then murder's out of tune,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And sweet revenge grows harsh.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: O, falsely, falsely murder'd!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Alas, what cry is that?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That! what?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Out, and alas! that was my lady's voice.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Help! help, ho! help! O lady, speak again!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Sweet Desdemona! O sweet mistress, speak!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: A guiltless death I die.
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: O, who hath done this deed?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: DESDEMONA
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Nobody; I myself. Farewell
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: Commend me to my kind lord: O, farewell!
lines.speaker: DESDEMONA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Why, how should she be murder'd?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Alas, who knows?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: You heard her say herself, it was not I.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: She said so: I must needs report the truth.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: She's, like a liar, gone to burning hell:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: 'Twas I that kill'd her.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: O, the more angel she,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: And you the blacker devil!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: She turn'd to folly, and she was a whore.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Thou dost belie her, and thou art a devil.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: She was false as water.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Thou art rash as fire, to say
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: That she was false: O, she was heavenly true!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Cassio did top her; ask thy husband else.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: O, I were damn'd beneath all depth in hell,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: But that I did proceed upon just grounds
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: To this extremity. Thy husband knew it all.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: My husband!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Thy husband.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: That she was false to wedlock?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Ay, with Cassio. Nay, had she been true,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: If heaven would make me such another world
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Of one entire and Perfect chrysolite,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I'ld not have sold her for it.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: My husband!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Ay, 'twas he that told me first:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: An honest man he is, and hates the slime
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That sticks on filthy deeds.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: My husband!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: What needs this iteration, woman? I say thy husband.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: O mistress, villany hath made mocks with love,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: My husband say that she was false!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: He, woman;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I say thy husband: dost understand the word?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: My friend, thy husband, honest, honest Iago.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: If he say so, may his pernicious soul
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Rot half a grain a day! he lies to the heart:
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: She was too fond of her most filthy bargain.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Ha!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Do thy worst:
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: This deed of thine is no more worthy heaven
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Than thou wast worthy her.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Peace, you were best.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Thou hast not half that power to do me harm
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: As I have to be hurt. O gull! O dolt!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: As ignorant as dirt! thou hast done a deed--
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I care not for thy sword; I'll make thee known,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Though I lost twenty lives.--Help! help, ho! help!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: The Moor hath kill'd my mistress! Murder! murder!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: MONTANO
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: What is the matter? How now, general!
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: O, are you come, Iago? you have done well,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: That men must lay their murders on your neck.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: What is the matter?
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Disprove this villain, if thou be'st a man:
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: He says thou told'st him that his wife was false:
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I know thou didst not, thou'rt not such a villain:
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Speak, for my heart is full.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I told him what I thought, and told no more
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Than what he found himself was apt and true.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: But did you ever tell him she was false?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I did.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: You told a lie, an odious, damned lie;
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Upon my soul, a lie, a wicked lie.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: She false with Cassio!--did you say with Cassio?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: With Cassio, mistress. Go to, charm your tongue.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I will not charm my tongue; I am bound to speak:
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: My mistress here lies murder'd in her bed,--
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: All
lines.speaker: All

lines.value: O heavens forfend!
lines.speaker: All

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: And your reports have set the murder on.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Nay, stare not, masters: it is true, indeed.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: 'Tis a strange truth.
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: MONTANO
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: O monstrous act!
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Villany, villany, villany!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I think upon't, I think: I smell't: O villany!--
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I thought so then:--I'll kill myself for grief:--
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: O villany, villany!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: What, are you mad? I charge you, get you home.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Good gentlemen, let me have leave to speak:
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: 'Tis proper I obey him, but not now.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Perchance, Iago, I will ne'er go home.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: O! O! O!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Nay, lay thee down and roar;
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: For thou hast kill'd the sweetest innocent
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: That e'er did lift up eye.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: [Rising]  O, she was foul!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I scarce did know you, uncle: there lies your niece,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Whose breath, indeed, these hands have newly stopp'd:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I know this act shows horrible and grim.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: Poor Desdemona! I am glad thy father's dead:
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: Thy match was mortal to him, and pure grief
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: Shore his old thread in twain: did he live now,
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: This sight would make him do a desperate turn,
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: Yea, curse his better angel from his side,
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: And fall to reprobation.
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: 'Tis pitiful; but yet Iago knows
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That she with Cassio hath the act of shame
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: A thousand times committed; Cassio confess'd it:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And she did gratify his amorous works
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: With that recognizance and pledge of love
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Which I first gave her; I saw it in his hand:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: It was a handkerchief, an antique token
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: My father gave my mother.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: O heaven! O heavenly powers!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Come, hold your peace.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: 'Twill out, 'twill out: I peace!
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: No, I will speak as liberal as the north:
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Let heaven and men and devils, let them all,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: All, all, cry shame against me, yet I'll speak.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Be wise, and get you home.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I will not.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: Fie!
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: Your sword upon a woman?
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: O thou dull Moor! that handkerchief thou speak'st of
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: I found by fortune and did give my husband;
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: For often, with a solemn earnestness,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: More than indeed belong'd to such a trifle,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: He begg'd of me to steal it.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Villanous whore!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: She give it Cassio! no, alas! I found it,
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: And I did give't my husband.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Filth, thou liest!
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: By heaven, I do not, I do not, gentlemen.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: O murderous coxcomb! what should such a fool
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Do with so good a woman?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Are there no stones in heaven
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: But what serve for the thunder?--Precious villain!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: The woman falls; sure, he hath kill'd his wife.
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Ay, ay: O, lay me by my mistress' side.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: He's gone, but his wife's kill'd.
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: MONTANO
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: 'Tis a notorious villain. Take you this weapon,
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: Which I have here recover'd from the Moor:
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: Come, guard the door without; let him not pass,
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: But kill him rather. I'll after that same villain,
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: For 'tis a damned slave.
lines.speaker: MONTANO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I am not valiant neither,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: But ever puny whipster gets my sword:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: But why should honour outlive honesty?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Let it go all.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: EMILIA
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: What did thy song bode, lady?
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Hark, canst thou hear me? I will play the swan.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: And die in music.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Willow, willow, willow,--
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: Moor, she was chaste; she loved thee, cruel Moor;
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: So come my soul to bliss, as I speak true;
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: So speaking as I think, I die, I die.
lines.speaker: EMILIA

lines.value: OTHELLO

lines.value: I have another weapon in this chamber;

lines.value: O, here it is. Uncle, I must come forth.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: [Within]  If thou attempt it, it will cost thee dear:

lines.value: Thou hast no weapon, and perforce must suffer.
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Look in upon me then and speak with me,

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: What is the matter?
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Behold, I have a weapon;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: A better never did itself sustain
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Upon a soldier's thigh: I have seen the day,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That, with this little arm and this good sword,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I have made my way through more impediments
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Than twenty times your stop: but, O vain boast!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Who can control his fate? 'tis not so now.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Be not afraid, though you do see me weapon'd;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Here is my journey's end, here is my butt,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And very sea-mark of my utmost sail.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Do you go back dismay'd? 'tis a lost fear;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Man but a rush against Othello's breast,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And he retires. Where should Othello go?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Now, how dost thou look now? O ill-starr'd wench!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Pale as thy smock! when we shall meet at compt,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: This look of thine will hurl my soul from heaven,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And fiends will snatch at it. Cold, cold, my girl!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Even like thy chastity. O cursed slave!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Whip me, ye devils,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: From the possession of this heavenly sight!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Blow me about in winds! roast me in sulphur!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Wash me in steep-down gulfs of liquid fire!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: O Desdemona! Desdemona! dead!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Oh! Oh! Oh!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Where is this rash and most unfortunate man?
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That's he that was Othello: here I am.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Where is that viper? bring the villain forth.
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I look down towards his feet; but that's a fable.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: If that thou best a devil, I cannot kill thee.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Wrench his sword from him.
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: I bleed, sir; but not kill'd.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I am not sorry neither: I'ld have thee live;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: For, in my sense, 'tis happiness to die.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: O thou Othello, thou wert once so good,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Fall'n in the practise of a damned slave,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: What shall be said to thee?
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Why, any thing:
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: An honourable murderer, if you will;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: For nought I did in hate, but all in honour.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: This wretch hath part confess'd his villany:
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Did you and he consent in Cassio's death?
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Ay.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Dear general, I never gave you cause.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I do believe it, and I ask your pardon.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Will you, I pray, demand that demi-devil
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Why he hath thus ensnared my soul and body?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: IAGO
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: Demand me nothing: what you know, you know:
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: From this time forth I never will speak word.
lines.speaker: IAGO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: What, not to pray?
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: Torments will ope your lips.
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Well, thou dost best.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Sir, you shall understand what hath befall'n,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Which, as I think, you know not. Here is a letter
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Found in the pocket of the slain Roderigo;
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: And here another: the one of them imports
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: The death of Cassio to be undertook
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: By Roderigo.
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: O villain!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Most heathenish and most gross!
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Now here's another discontented paper,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Found in his pocket too; and this, it seems,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Roderigo meant to have sent this damned villain;
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: But that belike Iago in the interim
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Came in and satisfied him.
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: O the pernicious caitiff!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: How came you, Cassio, by that handkerchief
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: That was my wife's?
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: I found it in my chamber:
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: And he himself confess'd but even now
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: That there he dropp'd it for a special purpose
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Which wrought to his desire.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: O fool! fool! fool!
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: There is besides in Roderigo's letter,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: How he upbraids Iago, that he made him
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Brave me upon the watch; whereon it came
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: That I was cast: and even but now he spake,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: After long seeming dead, Iago hurt him,
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: Iago set him on.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: You must forsake this room, and go with us:
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Your power and your command is taken off,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: And Cassio rules in Cyprus. For this slave,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: If there be any cunning cruelty
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: That can torment him much and hold him long,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: It shall be his. You shall close prisoner rest,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Till that the nature of your fault be known
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: To the Venetian state. Come, bring him away.
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Soft you; a word or two before you go.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I have done the state some service, and they know't.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: No more of that. I pray you, in your letters,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: When you shall these unlucky deeds relate,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Speak of me as I am; nothing extenuate,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Nor set down aught in malice: then must you speak
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Of one that loved not wisely but too well;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Of one not easily jealous, but being wrought
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Perplex'd in the extreme; of one whose hand,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Like the base Indian, threw a pearl away
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Richer than all his tribe; of one whose subdued eyes,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Albeit unused to the melting mood,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Drop tears as fast as the Arabian trees
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Their medicinal gum. Set you down this;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And say besides, that in Aleppo once,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Where a malignant and a turban'd Turk
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Beat a Venetian and traduced the state,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I took by the throat the circumcised dog,
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: And smote him, thus.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: O bloody period!
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: GRATIANO
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: All that's spoke is marr'd.
lines.speaker: GRATIANO

lines.value: OTHELLO
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: I kiss'd thee ere I kill'd thee: no way but this;
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: Killing myself, to die upon a kiss.
lines.speaker: OTHELLO

lines.value: CASSIO
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: This did I fear, but thought he had no weapon;
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: For he was great of heart.
lines.speaker: CASSIO

lines.value: LODOVICO
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: [To IAGO]  O Spartan dog,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: More fell than anguish, hunger, or the sea!
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Look on the tragic loading of this bed;
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: This is thy work: the object poisons sight;
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Let it be hid. Gratiano, keep the house,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: And seize upon the fortunes of the Moor,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: For they succeed on you. To you, lord governor,
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Remains the censure of this hellish villain;
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: The time, the place, the torture: O, enforce it!
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: Myself will straight aboard: and to the state
lines.speaker: LODOVICO

lines.value: This heavy act with heavy heart relate.
lines.speaker: LODOVICO
